headline: SK Hynix Bets $13 Billion To Lock In AI Memory Dominance
summary: SK Hynix, Samsung Electronics Co. Ltd. (OTC:SSNLF), and global rivals, including Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Ltd. (NYSE:TSM) and Micron Technology Inc. (NASDAQ:MU), are accelerating investments as competition intensifies to supply high-bandwidth memory and advanced chips for the artificial intelligence boom. headline: Dividend Investor Making $10,000 a Month Shares His Top 8 Stocks, Says AI Stocks Helped Him Reach Goals – 'Tempted To Just Go Ahead And Retire'
summary: Dividend stocks are drawing renewed attention as geopolitical tensions rise and concerns about the labor market grow. Investors like dividend stocks because they tend to hold up better during periods of market volatility. In June, a Redditor shared his dividend income details and portfolio on r/Dividends, a community of dividend investors with 220,000 members. The portfolio screenshots shared by the investor showed his monthly dividend income stood at $10,097 per month. Don't Miss: The AI Market

headline: Trump places 25% tariff on AI chips with some exemptions
summary: The Trump administration has placed a 25% tariff on “certain advanced computing chips," according to a White House statement, with exemptions for chips contributing to the buildout of the US AI infrastructure. Crossmark Global Investments chief market strategist Victoria Fernandez comments on this announcement. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

content.title: Trump places 25% tariff on AI chips with some exemptions
content.description:
The Trump administration has placed a 25% tariff on “certain advanced computing chips," according to a White House statement, with exemptions for chips contributing to the buildout of the US AI infrastructure.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Micron says the memory shortage crisis is here to stay
summary: Micron says the global memory crunch isn't a short-term problem. With AI data centers demanding more DRAM than ever, even expanded production won't bring real relief before 2028. The post Micron says the memory shortage crisis is here to stay appeared first on Digital Trends.

content.title: Micron says the memory shortage crisis is here to stay
content.summary: Micron says the global memory crunch isn't a short-term problem. With AI data centers demanding more DRAM than ever, even expanded production won't bring real relief before 2028. The post Micron says the memory shortage crisis is here to stay appeared first on Digital Trends.

headline: Why Micron (MU) Stock Is Up Today
summary: Shares of memory chips maker Micron (NYSE:MU) jumped 3.1% in the afternoon session after several analysts issued positive ratings and price target increases, citing surging demand for the company's memory chips used in artificial intelligence. The optimism was fueled by reports that Micron's High-Bandwidth Memory (HBM), a key component for powering AI processors, was sold out through 2026.
